title: Lamar Odom Has Taken 'A Few Steps,' Says Family
text: Lamar Odom Transferred to Undisclosed Location in Los Angeles By ROBERT ZEPEDA Oct 20, 2015, 10:57 AM ET 0 Shares Star Jeff Lewis/AP Photo In this July 31, 2009, file photo, Los Angeles Lakers' Lamar Odom speaks to the media during a news conference in El Segundo, Calif. 0 Shares Just a week after being found unconscious in a legal brothel in Nevada, Lamar Odom was transferred from Sunrise Hospital and Medical Center in Las Vegas to an undisclosed location in Los Angeles. His family released a statement today, calling his progress nothing short of "miraculous." Related: Lamar Odom Opens His Eyes Days After Being Found Unconscious at Love Ranch Brothel "On behalf of JaNean Mercer and the entire Odom family, we would like to send a tremendous THANK YOU to the illustrious medical team at Sunrise Hospital and Medical Center in Las Vegas," a rep for the Odom family said in a statement. "Your superb, round-the-clock care gave us the comfort and assurances we desperately needed to know Lamar would persevere. As Lamar begins a new chapter in his road to recovery, PLEASE continue to uplift him and the family in prayer." The statement continued, "He continues to make miraculous progress, taking a few steps in Los Angeles. We couldn't be more overjoyed! We realize Lamar's continued improvement will not be easy, however his unrelenting strength and faith in God will pull him through." The former NBA star, 35, has been in the hospital since last Tuesday after being found unresponsive at the Love Ranch in Crystal, Nev. When rescuers arrived at brothel, Odom was "unconscious but breathing," Nye County Sheriff Sharon Wehrly told reporters last week. Police also said that a Love Ranch worker told 911 dispatchers that the former basketball player had been using cocaine and sexual enhancement drugs in the days before the incident. Last Friday Odom opened his eyes. Since then, his family has been updating fans, saying just yesterday that everyday he's "getting stronger." "Lamar has always been blessed with a tenacious, fighting spirit, overcoming insurmountable obstacles to achieve the impossible. These past few days have been no different," JaNean Mercer, Odom's aunt, said Monday in a statement. "He is defying the odds in his toughest battle to date with God's grace. Each day Lamar is getting stronger and reaching significant milestones in his recovery. We are committed to remaining by his side as a family for our champion, who we love immensely." After the incident, Odom first received treatment at Pahrump's Desert View Hospital, then was transferred to Sunrise Hospital. He's now in Los Angeles, according to family. TV reality star Khloe Kardashian married Odom in 2009, but filed for divorce four years later. Both parties signed the divorce papers earlier this year. 0 Shares
